item.title: Some Thoughts on Zig — Sympolymathesy, by Chris Krycho
item.description: One of the biggest things Zig has going for it—especially compared to Rust—is that it is (relatively) small. That sits in tension with Rust’s approach to solving memory safety problems, and sets up a nice challenge for future programming language designers.

item.title: Gregor Riegler · Getting better at CI
item.description: I recently felt the urge to experiment with my TDD workflow and improve it. It had too many manual steps, like running the tests, starting a commit, writing a commit message, pulling changes, and pushing it. It felt boring and wasteful. I want to automate this stuff and eliminate all the waste.

item.title: Stop using so many CTEs - Blog | Hex
item.description: Why it's time to "break up" with your favorite SQL feature

item.title: Please stop trying to be helpful – Cliffski's Blog
item.description: A minute ago, I tried reading an article on a super-popular news site. The page it opened had no scrollbar, and as with all modern ‘writing’, the top 800 pixels is a large image, rather than any text. Luckily, my laptop has a touch screen but….no joy. I still can’t scroll. I just assume that this is some stupid clash with ghostery, so turn it off. The site still cannot scroll. I’m sure the content must exist, I just am not technically able to access it.

item.title: How to advertise to developers: deep dive into paid developer marketing
item.description: Deep dive into running paid ads on developers (which is hard). I go through first principles, then dive into best practices, targeting, creatives, landing pages, channels and examples from the best developer-focused companies.

item.title: Skills required for a CTO - be transformational – Another look on tech
item.description: Today, most companies have a CTO. Title, responsibilities, and expectations of the job may vary per company, as there is no singular definition of a “CTO”. But what I notice from various assignments in the software and technology industry is a convergence of the skills required to fill the role of a CTO.
